alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 3:46AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FREEZE UP ICE JAMS ONGOING IN ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MAT-SU VALLEY... Recent abnormally cold temperatures have caused many rivers and streams across the Anchorage and Mat-Su areas to rapidly freeze up. This has caused ice jams to form on some waterways leading to localized overflow flooding in vicinity of the ice jams. Currently, an ice jam on Campbell Creek near the Old Seward Highway is causing the creek to overflow its banks and flood portions of the Campbell Creek Bike Path. Additionally, a resident reported flooding on Wasilla Creek about a mile south of the Trunk Road/Palmer-Fishhook intersection due to a likely ice jam on the creek. As temperatures warm above freezing over the next couple of days, water levels may rise further due to runoff from snow melt. By the weekend, ice jam related flooding issues should likely decrease as warmer temperatures are expected to erode away the river ice allowing water levels to decrease.
